refnamediv.refpurpose: Remove the binding of a feature to a model/archetype/personality

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The aq unbind feature command removes the binding of a feature to a model, archetype or personality.

listitem.para: The name of the feature to unbind.
Name of a hardware model. If the model refers to a machine, then FEATURE must be a hardware feature. If the model refers to a network interface, then FEATURE must be an interface feature.
Name of the vendor, if MODEL is not unique.
Name of a personality. FEATURE must be a host feature, unless --model or --interface is also specified, in which case the rules for the respective option apply.

Name of an archetype. If --personality is used, then this option is used as a qualifier to select the right archetype if the name of the personality is not unique. If this option is used without --personality, then it specifies the archetype to change.

Changing archetype bindings is subject to change management control and requires the use of option --justification. The only exception is when the archetype has no hosts (i.e. when it is still under development); in this case --justification is not needed.
Name of a network interface. FEATURE must be an interface feature, and it gets activated only for interfaces named IFACE.
Specifies the justification of the change. This option is required if the scope of the operation exceeds a personality (i.e. if you're modifying archetype bindings).
The syntax of REASON is MANAGER=TICKET, where MANAGER is the change manager like tcm for TCM2, and TICKET is the ticket number (the TCM number when using TCM2).
Specify if the plenary templates of affected hosts should be updated (--flush), or not (--noflush). The default is to flush host templates.
Note that updating the plenary templates for a whole archetype can take a long time.

example.title: Unbind a host feature from a personality
Unbind a host feature from an archetype
example.programlisting: aq bind feature --feature foo --archetype aquilon --justification tcm=600123456

example.title: Unbind a hardware feature from a personality and model
example.programlisting: aq bind feature --feature foo --model dx320-6388ac1 --personality unixeng-test

example.title: Unbind an interface feature from a personality
example.programlisting: aq bind feature --feature foo --personality unixeng-test --interface bond1
